title: Lost on the Subway
description: Mina, a 16-year-old high school student in Seoul, is navigating the subway system for the first time alone.

chapters.title: First Day Out Alone
chapters.description: Mina studies the subway map and prepares for her journey to Hongdae Entrance Station. Feeling a mix of nervousness and pride, she boards the subway. However, as the station names flash by too quickly, she begins to worry she might have missed her stop.

Because it's the first time in my life I'm taking the subway alone all the way to Hongdae.
sentences.방금 친구에게 \"나 지금 출발해!: I just texted my friend, "I'm leaving now!
sentences.\"라고 문자를 보냈지만, 사실 심장이 발끝에서부터 목구멍까지 쿵쾅거리고: But actually, my heart was pounding from my toes to my throat.
My palms were sweaty with a mix of pride and a rush of anxiety.
I meticulously checked the Seoul subway map spread out on the table once more.
sentences.출발역에서 환승역까지, 그리고 목적지인 홍대입구역까지 손가락으로 선을 따: I traced the route with my finger, from the starting station to the transfer station, and then to Hongdae-ipgu Station, my destination.
I ran the simulation dozens of times in my head.
sentences.혹시라도 잘못 내리거나, 엉뚱한 방향으로 가면 어쩌지?: What if I get off at the wrong station, or go in the wrong direction?
"Hongdae-ipgu Station... Hongdae-ipgu Station..." I muttered to myself unconsciously.
The station name lingered in my mouth.
I repeated it as if I were chanting a spell.
sentences.외워야 해, 절대로 잊으면 안 돼!: I have to memorize it, I absolutely cannot forget it!
My steps leaving the house were heavier than I expected.
sentences.익숙한 동네 골목을 지나 지하철역 입구에 도착하자, 차가운 공기가 코끝을: After passing through familiar neighborhood alleys and arriving at the subway station entrance, cold air brushed against the tip of my nose.
I took a deep breath and passed through the turnstile.
It was as if someone in my head was welcoming me.
sentences.스크린 도어 앞에 서서 열차를 기다리는데, 저 멀리서 지하철이 굉음을 내: Standing in front of the screen doors, waiting for the train, I heard the subway approaching with a loud roar in the distance.
A massive gust of wind rushed in.
Finally, the train arrived, and the doors opened.
A gush of warm air poured out.
Passengers streamed out, and I cautiously stepped inside.
I grabbed an empty handgrip and stood to one side.
Clunk, the doors closed, and the train began to move smoothly.
The dark tunnel outside the window sped by.
Inside the subway, riding alone for the first time, it felt strangely unfamiliar and mysterious.
Everyone was doing their own thing.
Some were looking at their smartphones, others reading books, and some were nodding off.
sentences.나는 그저 벽에 붙은 노선도를 힐끗 보고, 열차 칸마다 설치된 전광판에: I simply glanced at the route map posted on the wall and fixed my gaze on the electronic display panels installed in each train car.
The announcement for the second station after the first one played.
Station names appeared clearly on the electronic display and then vanished.
sentences.'선릉, 역삼, 강남…' 전광판의 글씨가 바뀌는 속도가 점점 빨라지는 것: 'Seolleung, Yeoksam, Gangnam...' The speed at which the text on the display changed seemed to be getting faster.
I had definitely checked the route map carefully.
A growing sense of anxiety crept over me.
sentences.내 눈이 전광판을 쫓아가지 못하는 건가?: Are my eyes not keeping up with the display?
sentences.아니면 열차가 너무 빠른 건가?: Or is the train going too fast?
The station names flashing by changed in an instant.
sentences.한두 정거장 전쯤부터는 집중해서 봐야 하는데, 눈 깜짝할 새에 '사당'역: I should have been paying close attention from one or two stations before, but 'Sadang' station and 'Isu' station flashed by in the blink of an eye.
I was clearly counting each station as I came...
I started to get the feeling something was wrong.
sentences.설마… 벌써 홍대입구역을 지나쳐버린 건 아니겠지?: Surely... I haven't already passed Hongdae-ipgu Station, have I?

chapters.title: The Missed Station
chapters.description: Mina politely asks a passenger, "Is this Hongdae Entrance Station?" but is told that they've already passed three stops. The passenger advises, "You need to go back," but suddenly, an announcement is made: "This is the terminal station."

The scenery outside the subway window was becoming increasingly unfamiliar.
Hongdae Entrance Station, where I should have gotten off, seemed to have already passed a long time ago.
sentences.역 이름이 전광판에 뜨는 속도도, 안내 방송이 흘러나오는 속도도 너무 빨: The speed at which the station names appeared on the electronic display and the announcements flowed out was so fast that I couldn't possibly get my bearings.
sentences.분명 아까는 익숙한 이름이 보였던 것 같은데, 지금은 전혀 모르는 지명들: I was sure I had seen familiar names a moment ago, but now only completely unfamiliar place names appeared one after another.
My heart began to pound more and more intensely.
I knew I couldn't just let this continue.
However, talking to a stranger was something I had never even imagined doing.
sentences.한국에서는 지하철에서 조용히 있는 것이 예의라는 말을 들었고, 괜히 남에: I had heard that it was polite to be quiet on the subway in Korea, and I hesitated, feeling like I might be bothering someone unnecessarily.
sentences.괜히 질문해서 민망해지면?: What if I ask unnecessarily and end up embarrassed?
A myriad of thoughts swirled in my head.
sentences.그러나 이대로 가다간 어디까지 갈지 모른다는 생각에, 나는 용기를 내기로: But at the thought that I didn't know how far I would go if I kept going like this, I decided to pluck up my courage.
Looking around, an elderly woman sitting in the seat in front of me caught my eye.
She looked kind, so I approached her cautiously.
My throat was parched, and I swallowed hard.
"Um... Excuse me, but..." I barely managed to speak.
The elderly woman turned her head and looked at me.
I faltered, and asked as politely as possible.
sentences.\\\"여기가… 여기가 홍대입구역이에요?: "Is this... is this Hongdae Entrance Station?
" My voice trembled more than I expected.
The elderly woman heard my question and her eyes widened.
Then she immediately looked at me with an expression full of pity.
Hongdae Entrance Station has already passed.
sentences.\\\" 아주머니의 말이 내 귀에 꽂히자마자 머릿속이 새하얘지는 기분이었: As soon as the elderly woman's words hit my ears, my mind felt like it went blank.
" When I asked again, the elderly woman nodded her head.
You've passed Hapjeong and Dangsan, and this is Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Station.
It looks like you've come about... three more stations.
To merely find Hongdae Entrance Station, I had already passed three stations.
I felt as if my heart had plummeted.
My hands were drenched in a cold sweat.
" Everything went black before my eyes.
The elderly woman spoke calmly to me, with a reassuring expression.
Get off at the next station and transfer to the opposite direction.
"Go back...?" Those words felt like a huge mountain.
sentences.지하철을 다시 타는 방법도 모르는데!: I don't even know how to ride the subway again!
Just as my mind became a tangled mess, an unfamiliar announcement echoed in my ears.
This station... this station is the terminal station.

chapters.title: Chaos at the Terminus
chapters.description: Mina alights from the terminal station and enters a large, unfamiliar station. She follows the crowd, but the signs are confusing. A kind elderly woman offers help, but she speaks in fast Korean, making it difficult to understand. The elderly woman points at an escalator, saying "Go quickly!", but Mina doesn't know where to go.

The subway doors opened wide with a 'beep' sound.
A blast of cold air, accompanied by a roaring sound, instantly enveloped my face.
\"This station is the last stop for this train.\"
\"Even before the announcement finished, people surged out from behind.\"
Without realizing it, I, too, stepped out of the train, as if pushed by the crowd.
It felt as if I had no choice but to be swept along by the urgent movements of the people around me.
As soon as I stepped out, I was overwhelmed by the colossal space.
The station I had gotten off at was not Hongdae Entrance Station.
The station was much wider and more complex than I had imagined.
sentences.웅장한 천장은 저 멀리 아득하게 뻗어 있었고, 수많은 조명들이 눈부시게: The majestic ceiling stretched endlessly into the distance, and countless lights shone dazzlingly.
sentences.사방에서 울려 퍼지는 안내방송과 기차 도착을 알리는 멜로디, 그리고 발소: Announcements echoing from all directions, melodies signaling train arrivals, and the sounds of footsteps and murmuring conversations mingled together, forming a vast sea of noise.
sentences.사람들로 가득 찬 승강장은 걷잡을 수 없이 북적였고, 끊임없이 움직이는: The platform, packed with people, was overwhelmingly crowded, and amidst the constantly moving throngs, I felt like a tiny dot.
Having completely lost my sense of direction, I stood there in a daze.
My hands were clammy with sweat.
I need to get back to Hongdae Entrance Station...
For now, I started walking towards where most people were headed.
sentences.파도처럼 밀려가는 인파에 휩쓸려 나도 모르게 긴 통로를 따라 에스컬레이터: Swept away by the crowd surging like waves, I unknowingly headed towards the escalators along a long corridor.
But the moment I looked up at the signs, an even greater wave of confusion washed over me.
sentences.머리 위로는 온갖 방향을 가리키는 화살표와 낯선 역 이름들이 빼곡하게 적: Above my head, arrows pointing in all directions and unfamiliar station names were densely written.
Even though it was clearly Hangeul, it looked like an alien language.
My eyes got lost in the flood of text.
sentences.홍대입구역을 찾아보려 했지만, 내 눈엔 그저 수많은 글자들이 뒤죽박죽 섞: I tried to find Hongdae Entrance Station, but to my eyes, it was just a jumbled mess of countless characters.
My heart was pounding with urgency, but no matter how hard I looked, I couldn't tell where anything was.
A deepening sense of anxiety began to overwhelm me.
sentences.\\\"학생, 혹시 길 잃었니?: \"Young one, have you lost your way?
sentences.이 아가씨 어디로 가려고 이렇게 멍하니 서 있나?: Where are you trying to go, standing here so dazed, my dear?\"
A friendly yet quick voice came from somewhere.
sentences.옆을 돌아보니, 곱게 한복을 입으신 할머니 한 분이 나를 지긋이 보고 계: Turning to my side, I saw a grandmother, elegantly dressed in a hanbok, looking at me with a steady gaze.
Her eyes were full of worry, yet she wore a gentle smile.
I was so surprised that I quickly bowed in greeting.
\"The grandmother's next words were spoken too quickly for me to fully understand.\"
Such words stuck in my ears like fragments, but I couldn't connect them to form a coherent context.
I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch that...\"
sentences.\\\" 내가 어설프게 더듬거리자, 할머니는 인자한 미소를 지으며 고개를: \"As I stammered awkwardly, the grandmother nodded, a benevolent smile on her face.\"
Her hand, tapping my shoulder, was warm.
\"Oh dear, this young lady was lost.
sentences.이쪽으로 빨리 가야 해!: You must go this way quickly!
You shouldn't wander around at this hour.\"
sentences.\\\" 할머니는 나를 이끄시며 손가락으로 저 멀리 어떤 방향을 가리키셨: \"The grandmother led me, pointing her finger far into a certain direction.\"
Her gesture was firm and clear.
sentences.\\\"지금 가면 막차 놓쳐!: \"If you go now, you'll miss the last train!
sentences.\\\" 할머니의 목소리는 다급했지만, 그 안에는 나를 향한 따뜻한 걱: \"The grandmother's voice was urgent, but within it was warm concern and consideration for me.\"
—those words distinctly echoed in my ears.
sentences.할머니의 손짓이 가리키는 곳을 보니, 수많은 사람들이 줄지어 올라가고 있: Looking to where the grandmother's gesture pointed, I saw a long, massive escalator with countless people queuing up to ascend it.
sentences.어디로 가는지 알 수는 없었지만, 할머니의 말에는 거역할 수 없는 권위와: Although I didn't know where it was going, I felt an undeniable sense of authority and kindness in the grandmother's words simultaneously.
I instinctively realized there was no more time to hesitate.
sentences.\\\" 나는 급히 인사를 하고 할머니가 가리킨 에스컬레이터 쪽으로 몸을: \"I quickly bowed and turned towards the escalator the grandmother had pointed to.\"
sentences.할머니는 내가 제대로 가는 것을 확인하고 나서야 안심한 듯 고개를 끄덕이: Only after the grandmother confirmed that I was going the right way did she nod, as if relieved.
sentences.뒤를 돌아볼 틈도 없이, 나는 수많은 사람들 틈에 섞여 에스컬레이터에 발: Without a moment to look back, I mingled among the countless people and stepped onto the escalator.
sentences.빠르게 위로 솟아오르는 에스컬레이터 위에서, 거대하고 혼란스러운 역이 점: On the rapidly ascending escalator, I watched the vast and chaotic station recede into the distance.
I still had no idea where I was heading.
—only those words lingered in my ears.
sentences.이 에스컬레이터는 나를 어디로 데려다줄까?: Where would this escalator take me?
sentences.이 혼란 속에서 겨우 한 발짝 내디딘 것 같았지만, 다음은 또 어떤 미로: It felt like I had only taken one step in this chaos, but I had no idea what kind of labyrinth awaited me next.
